definition[0]: to decide that something will be used for a particular purpose or have something done to it in the future
example[0]: 85% of foreign aid is earmarked by Congress for specific purposes.
example[2]: He had been earmarked as a potential leader.
definition[1]: to plan to use something for a particular purpose or to give someone a particular role
example[3]: Of the money provided, 80% was earmarked for use in metropolitan areas.
example[4]: He had been earmarked as a possible successor to Bush.
